intro: Gnaphalium simplicicaule, commonly known as the simple-stemmed everlasting flower, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges, thriving in partial to full sunlight. Its fluffy, pale yellow to white flower heads are composed of numerous tiny florets, and the plant is known for its long-lasting dried flowers. Gnaphalium simplicicaule is also noted for its aromatic foliage, which emits a subtle, minty scent.
